introductionHtml:
Introduction to Conference Galleries on Squarespace

Creating an engaging conference gallery website on Squarespace can significantly enhance the visibility and impact of your conference presentations, talks, or exhibitions. Whether you're a conference organizer, photographer, or attendee, showcasing images from the event provides value to participants and stakeholders, and serves as a lasting archive of the experience. This guide will take you through the intricacies of how to effectively upload images to a conference gallery website on Squarespace, with tips on how to craft a gallery that resonates with viewers.
mainContentHtml:
Step-by-Step Guide to Uploading Images

1. Set Up Your Gallery Page

Begin by logging into your Squarespace account. Navigate to your website's dashboard and click on the '+' icon to add a new page. Choose 'Gallery' from the available page types to create your gallery page specifically designed to showcase images from your conference.

2. Choose a Gallery Layout

Squarespace offers multiple gallery layouts including Grid, Slideshow, and Carousel. Select the one that best suits your event's theme and objectives. For conferences, a Grid layout usually works well as it allows multiple images to be viewed at once.

3. Upload Images

Click 'Edit' on your new gallery page. Drag and drop images directly into the squarespace gallery or click on the 'Upload Media' button to manually select your image files from your device. Ensure that your images are appropriately sized and formatted (JPEG or PNG formats are recommended).

4. Add Descriptions and Tags

After uploading, enhance each image's value by adding descriptions, titles, and tags. This not only improves viewer engagement but also boosts the SEO of your gallery, making it easier for search engines to index your content.
